page.title: 14Homelife in rural Sowerby
page.content: Most of the housing is in farms and tied cottages - cottages belonging to owners of farms where farm workers live. Some farms offer bed and breakfast hospitality for visitors to the area. Most homes own a freezer, and meat, fish and vegetables are preserved by freezing. Many of the farmers will freeze their own meat and vegetables for home consumption, instead of buying from shops. The majority of homes have an automatic washing machine for clothes, and several have dishwashers and microwave ovens, the latter being a quick energy saving way of cooking food. Most homes have a television and video recorders are becoming more popular. Heating is by solid fuel, oil or electricity. The most popular domestic pets are cats and dogs.
